website_summaries.verdict: The outdoor community may find the comfort level and waterproofness of this Columbia hiking boot as superb. Also, its grip on varied terrain and zero break-in period may leave users happy with this pair.However, there are some who are not glad about the insufficient arch support this boot offers. All in all, the Columbia Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped may remain a likable option for female hikers, granted its insole be replaced with a more supportive one.
pros: A Columbia Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped reviewer, along with countless buyers, applauds it for being a remarkably comfortable boot for hiking
According to numerous female adventurers, its liner is able and competent against most forms of wet trail conditions
The outsole of this Columbia product is sufficiently grippy, testifies a bunch of shoppers
Several outdoor enthusiasts declare that the Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped has no break-in period
A critic commends it for being a lightweight hiking boot for outdoor adventures
A minority of consumers appreciate the sturdiness of this footgear
cons: A couple of verified purchasers lament the Columbia Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped’s lack of arch support
Some outdoor enthusiasts experience excessive sweating when wearing this boot
A few customers say that its toe box is restrictive

customer_reviews.title: Hiking (Everest Base camp trek)
customer_reviews.text: I hike quite a bit because I am a SHERPA and I lead treks to Everest Base Camp, Nepal. (Hikewithsherpa.com) I go through a lot of hiking shoes. This by far are the best hiking shoes I have owned. very light and comfortable, also stylish. This summer I wore this shoes straight for 11 days (93 miles trek to Everest Base camp and back) I highly recommend this shoes! I will definitely buy it again. Join us for an adventure in the himalays!!! (hikewithsherpa.com)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: True to size, very comfortable and cute
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 7 in shoes but can wear a size 8 for Nike running shoes or some boots. I decided to order an 8 for these boots but they were just a tiny bit roomy, so I sized down to a 7.5 and they're perfect with hiking socks. They're so comfortable and I really like the look of them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty heavy boot and can probably withstand a lot
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty heavy boot and can probably withstand a lot, but it's also pretty uncomfortable. after a few hours, i couldn't stand hiking in them anymore or nevertheless, walk in them. There seems to be very little feet support and probably a lot of breaking in needed, which wasn't something I expected from the reviews I read. On the plus side, it went through mud, water, and those features did work well indeed.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like them
customer_reviews.text: I work on my feet all day and was looking for comfortable boots that would hold up. I must say these were very comfortable from the moment I put them on and looked nice,I really loved them until they started to fall apart after 3 weeks of wearing them, 1st the sole around the toe of one boot started to let go and then one of the eyelets for lace popped off. I do have Amazon Prime so it is easy to return and get credit but I am disappointed because I really did like them.
customer_reviews.author: loristaples

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Truly Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waterproof boot that would also be good for lots of walking. My feet are usually hard to fit, so I ordered 3 different sizes just to make sure I got one that fit. To my surprise, the pair that was my usual size fit perfectly, and I returned the others. I did a lot of walking in Ireland and Scotland, mostly in rainy weather, and these boots were true to their description. My feet were dry and comfortable. I did use an insert to ensure my feet were comfortable, but otherwise these boots surely fit the bill. I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Louise M

customer_reviews.title: Returned for a new pair only to have the same problem.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these, but there is clearly something wrong with the right boot. The left boot fit fine on the first pair, the right boot at the inside tip has bunched up fabric that pierces into my toes. Initiated my return and got a new pair two days later and SAME EXACT THING. Same side! Clearly something is wrong in production.
customer_reviews.author: mandamarierose

customer_reviews.title: I feel like mine are little lose but that might be different ...
customer_reviews.text: I heard everyone say they are a little small so order a size up. I feel like mine are little lose but that might be different if i wear hiking socks. I wear them all the time when I go for walks. They are even confertable enough to run in. I recently wore them on my trip to Arizona and handled the difference terrain well. Besides the style I love that they are water resistant, it’s going to be a godsend in the winter. I like them so much I told my cousin about them and she is ordering them in black!
customer_reviews.author: loraine hennessy

customer_reviews.title: Good but laces defective
customer_reviews.text: I love the boots and think they are great but I was sad to see that one of the laces was already frayed in the box. I don’t want to send them back for a shoelace but I wish it had come in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: if you buy these make sure the inside heel seam doesnt cut into your achilles
customer_reviews.text: these seemed perfectly fine at first. wore them on a three day backpacking trip this weekend and by day two my achilles was on fire. the seam on the inside of the heel is placed very inconveniently and cuts right into the achilles. the second half of my trip i walked barefoot for a few miles and was limping through it with the shoe on. this was only on my left foot but even now as im at home, my heel hurts so bad. really upsetting that i can never wear these again.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I bought these as a birthday gift and she loved it! I went with the recommended tip of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a birthday gift and she loved it! I went with the recommended tip of going a half size up and it was the perfect fit for her. She wears a 6 size shoes and I went with 6.5 and it worked perfectly. I have never purchased clothing/shoes online before so I was bit concern since I didn't get to see it in person or try it on beforehand, but it was exactly as described. Makes me want to get a pair for myself. I don't ever leave reviews but this was one that I had to share! It's so very stylish for hiking boots. Water proofed too!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Two different sizes
customer_reviews.text: I love Columbia products. My all time favorite hiking boots were from Columbia and I was recommended these boots from two people that loved them. I ordered a size 8 (not wide). Both boots were tag size 8 inside the boot but felt completely different! My toe was almost touching the tip of one boot, with plenty of room in the other. One boot felt snug around the sides/top of my foot while the other boot was wide. Other than that, the quality of the boots seemed great. I returned these back to Amazon and will go to Cabela's to try on/purchase a replacement pair, for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Rowdyboys

customer_reviews.title: Adorable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was ready for hiking boots and everyone told me to try this brand. The colors are amazing, really bright and cheerful (turquoise). Unfortunately, after a car accident and some follow up problems, my feet and legs swell. By the end of the day, the top was digging into my leg. This is my issue, I probably am not ready for this type of show. I miss high tops and hiking boots, but alas the first shape of the boot (which is probably a plus for a real hiker) was not working out. Excellent craftsmanship. Very sad to return.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboyspals

customer_reviews.title: Edit- Mediocre quality, still like them
customer_reviews.text: Edit****I do love the boots, however used them the other day, 3rd hike, and found part of the sole on my driveway when I got home from a hike. A day after I gave a great review. Now I question the quality of the product. They're comfortable and supportive, but sole breaking after 2 hikes😑 original review...Love these boots! Great investment, great support, traction.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika

customer_reviews.title: Best pair of boots I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best pair of boots I have ever purchased. They are incredibly comfortable, I can wear them for 14+ hours without my feet getting sore. I wish they made them in more funky colors like the blue & orange that I purchased! If they did I’d buy 3 more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Short Break-in Time
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was taking a chance in buying brand new hiking boots only 2 weeks before a trip, but I was lucky and elated that these boots fit well from the get-go, and with 4-5 days of wearing them at the office (yes, I'm lucky I can wear hiking boots at work!), marketing, dog walking, etc., they were absolutely comfy for the rocky, windy and muddy trails I came across. They got initiated in some serious mud but I was amazed to see how well they cleaned up with a stiff brush and water (see 2nd photo). Waterproofing works well, also. My foot measures 9.25" long, and I ordered size 6.5 M. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mjr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, waterproof, stylish and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned hiking boots before and this first pair wasn’t a let down! I really liked the red laces. At first I was a bit iffy about them, because I like to stick to more neutral colors, but ended of loving the pop it gave to my usually black hiking ensemble. I got a lot of compliments on them also! Hiked through about 2 miles of mud in them and my feet were dry and clean!
customer_reviews.author: Jenpen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: PROS: lightweight waterproof nice color box toe for wide/flat feet (I ordered the wide) true to size (ordered a 10. fits perfect) tread is grippy, no slip overall very comfortable ______ CONS: none ______ I did wear them for several hours the first day as they needed a little break in time, but that was it. Next day, I was out hiking around and they were great. They do feel a little boxy and clunky at first, which is why I wore them around the house, but really that was it. Just got a feel for them and they are lightweight and comfortable so no real problem there. RECOMMENDED? YES.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Great for moderate terrain & rainy weather
customer_reviews.text: I took the advixe of the others and ordered a 1/2 size larger. They fit perfectly. I will start off by saying that I am not a hiker. I bought these foe my trip to Alaska. They are lightweight and super comfortable. Surprisingly, I found myself reaching for these boots the entire trip. They are comparable to my New Balance (that I take everywhere). I reach for them on rainy days. They have been great. No wet feet. Ankle support is good. I actually bought these in August at $48. That was an excellent purchase for me. I recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: BCFNP1

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, entry level boot
customer_reviews.text: This boot is a great entry level hiking boot. I used it to hike in Southern Utah and they have held up well. They handle sand like a dream! My friends were pouring sand out of their shoes constantly during our hikes but I only emptied them at the end. I did notice some "hot spots" while wearing them but it was likely caused by the uneven terrain and the fact that I was wildly out of hiking practice. They're super cute too! I think they might not be the best for more intense hiking but for most Utah hikes, they seemed fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, comfortable and reading to hike hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Sold. That's what I said when other women reviewers said they didn't have to break in these boots and that they were comfortable. I also took the advice to buy a pair that was half a size bigger than my typical shoe size. It all proved to be true. I couldn't be happier with these boots. I wore them all over Italy in November 2019 when I wasn't wearing the rubber boots our hostess provided her guests for the Aqua Alta that became historic during my visit. Since then, I've continued enjoying wearing the boots at work (although they've become uncomfortable after extended periods and repeated wear after a couple hours) and on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Cassell

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE BOOTS!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the most comfortable boots I've ever had. They keep my feet warm and dry and feel so cushioned that they are extremely comfortable, like walking on pillows and have a lot of cushioning at the heel too. I'd give these 10 stars if I could! In fact I'd buy another pair in the whale/iceberg if it would be available for the same price. The traction is great too so it will be nice to use these for hiking as well as to keep my feet warm and dry in the Spring, Fall and Winter!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Comfy from the get-go!
customer_reviews.text: I have average width 9.5 feet. I read all the reviews on these boots, and from the other reviews, I opted to order a half size bigger because I like to wear thick wool socks when I hike. The size 10s are a perfect fit with my thicker socks. I have worn them all day since I got them earlier this morning. I haven't actually hiked any distance yet because I figured these boots would need some time to break in, but now I'm thinking that won't be necessary. These were comfortable from the moment I put them on. I can't wait to actually take to the trails in these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl H

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet dry and warm, 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.text: I read a ton of reviews before purchasing hiking boots for a trip out to Wyoming last week. I am so glad I trusted the reviews on these. We did over 70 miles of hiking on steep inclines in 6 days and my feet did not feel even remotely sore wearing these for every mile. We hiked in 8-10” of snow on a mountain top at less than 20* and my feet were completely warm and dry even with just one pair of socks on. I never felt the slightest bit of moisture or cold. I have never had even snow boots that were able to achieve this level of warmth. 10/10 would recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Royer

customer_reviews.title: Let's be adventurers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! only negative is the tongue does press a bit uncomfortably at first. but once you get the hang of folding them and wear them in a bit, they are super comfy. They have saved my ankles a few times, have used them hiking through state park hunting lands where trails aren't very developed and much of which is navigating through heavy boulder fields. They are great and kept my feet dry when crossing a few shallow streams.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Greenhalgh

customer_reviews.title: RETURNED!  ONE SHOE HAD BEEN USED
customer_reviews.text: NOT GOOD! This is really strange! One shoe had been used with salt stains and worn down treads, while the other shoe was brand new. This was not the first time according to another review.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for Rainy Day Hikers
customer_reviews.text: These boots are incredible! The traction is fabulous, feet stayed warm and dry, and the comfort was great. My ankles were a little sore AFTER I removed the boots- but I'm not used to wearing really good boots for hiking, so it's not the 'bad' sore. I had to play with the tongue and tightness a bit until I found the perfect fit (required of all lace up boots), and it was well worth it. Cons- I loved these boots so much that I was going to get a second pair- and they UPPED THE PRICE 20 bucks! Crossing my fingers that these will last a long, long time
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Reader

customer_reviews.title: Columbia never lets me down.
customer_reviews.text: I love these hiking boots. I had searched and searched for a stylish yet waterproof women’s hiking boot that wasn’t too clunky. I ordered the blue with coral laces. They are really an attractive shoe. They fit as expected. And there’s room for my smart wool socks. I love that the top 2 pairs of eyelets are actually hooks so that makes lacing up a snap. I’ve worn them around my house and they don’t feel stiff like they need breaking in. I bought these to go hiking in the wintertime on moderate trails and I noticed the treads are nice for gripping. This show is economical and cute and Columbia never lets me down.
customer_reviews.author: MLM

customer_reviews.title: Excited!
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews before deciding on this purchase and what size to order. I wear a size 9 and purchased a size 9. The boot fits perfectly. If I were to be wearing extra thick socks, I'd need to size up...but the hiking socks I have are comfortable but not very thick. First day, I wore them on a two mile walk and didn't take them off the rest of the day. They are very comfortable. I have not worn them for my vacation (which will include some moderate hiking) yet. I will update if there are any issues. I appreciate the other reviews immensely!
customer_reviews.author: A Mae

customer_reviews.title: Runs 1/2 size small, but great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. You can hike in these right out of the box without worrying about getting blisters. They are so comfortable. There is a ton of ankle support and are made well. I suspect these will last me a lifetime. The only downside is that they are a bit tight. I wear a size 6 in all my shoes except for these, where I feel I could have bought a 6.5. However, I was impatient and decided to keep them and have been wearing them, but I definitely couldn’t wear them with tight socks. And my toes touch the end. They aren’t uncomfortable... I just know I could have gone a half size large Rx
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Best Boots EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about these boots they are warm, dry, fit great, look high dollar and didn’t cost a lot. There’s no break in on them. Nothing rubbed the wrong way the cushion was a big surprise to me and as stiff as they felt going on I had no trouble navigating in them. You can’t go wrong with these. I’m tempted to get more in different colors because there were so many colors to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Cummins

customer_reviews.title: ATTENTION! GREAT HIKING SHOES!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Columbia for your "Newton Ridge" Plus Waterproof Amped Wide comfortable shoe! I ordered 1/2 size up. I wear 8 1/2 and ordered 9's. I also ordered wide due to my bunions. These just came in the mail and it feels like I'm walking on clouds. They are so comfortable and fit so perfectly that I will certainly be wearing these if not daily, almost daily, for all activities. Finally... a well made, thick soled, comfortable hiking shoe for women. I may just buy more of different colors! These are well worth the purchase. Happy Camper here!!!! A+++++
customer_reviews.author: Bishmaya

customer_reviews.title: Good boots for good price
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this Amazon seller/store and product. I purchased these boots as a replacement for a pair of Timberlands boots that I had worn for over 20 yrs and had worn them out. I find these Columbia boots true to size, I wear 8.5W ; and comfortable for this type of boot, which I wear in whatever inclement Winter weather we get here in East Tennessee. I selected these Columbia boots because of the reviews; they look similar to the Timberlands I had and these Columbia boots are less expensive in cost. I highly recommend these Columbia boots.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Ann Percle

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love my new boots!! These boots did not need to be broken in for me, I went on a quick 30min hike on a rocky, uphill, obstacle filled trail. They held my ankles stable the whole way and didn’t leave any lingering pain. I chose this pair for the color, but kind of wish I had gone with my usual black or dark grey color; these are more vibrant than I’m used to >U*
customer_reviews.author: ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself the favor, that’s coming from someone who suffers from foot pain from most other shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I had read all the reviews and even then I expected to be disappointed. BOY, was I wrong! They fit perfectly to my shoe size and from the first step I took I yelled as I walked around the house about how amazingly comfortable they feel. Snug fit without rubbing anywhere and there’s even enough space for my wool socks since I’ll be hiking in the cold. Can’t wait to take them out on the terrain! After my trip if there’s anything I find wrong I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Godoy

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, true to size, stylish hiking boots.
customer_reviews.text: I literally just put them on right out of the box. My first impression is that they are very comfortable and true to size - I am usually an 8, ordered an 8, tried them on with socks, and the fit is just right. They have great traction and I know these will be great on sandy/rocky trails. I love the ankle support, too. I also have to say the red accents and laces make these super stylish and classically cute!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these boots. I did order a half size up but I wish I didn't, I found my foot to be sliding around a lot with the half size up which caused a blister. Either way, if I double up on socks, these are extremely comfortable and even though I made the mistake of ordering a half size up they are still extremely comfortable hiking boots! They are waterproof and my sister and fried have the sa.e pair and both love them as well!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Masters

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I fixed the problem with feeling every bump on the bottom of the sole. I had to put insoles in the shoe for more comfort. Not the store bought cheap ones, solid leather with a arch. I can wear them now. When did hiking shoes start being made like the cheap tennis shoes. I've bought hiking shoes for years and now can't find a solid made boot that doesn't collapse in a short time. The company needs to re think and revise how the shoes are made because of the health of our feet. Maybe test wears on people, before selling in the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Shirlon Chesbro

customer_reviews.title: No toe cap=squashed toes
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these but as other reviews noted, when your foot bends, the "break" in the toe box goes right across the big toe resulting in a pressure point and ultimately poor performance. There is no reinforcement in the toe cap area at all. If you want "fashion" boots, they might be ok. The color is really pretty! But for hiking? No way.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof boots good for creek hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for hiking as a hobby. Lately I have been visiting about 2 state parks a week, and I wanted something with more support than sneakers. These work perfectly! I typically hike 6-8 miles each time. My favorite feature is that they are waterproof all the way up! The tongue is attached. This is great for crossing shallow streams and creeks! I can now really enjoy the “rugged” hikes where there is sometimes no dry foothold available. As I am writing this review, I have worn these about 6 times.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Young

customer_reviews.title: Quality and affordability
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear an 8.5-9 depending on the brand and style. I used prime wardrobe to try both the 8.5 and 9 in these boots, and I went with the 8.5. I've worn these several times hiking (easy to medium hard), and the fit is great (I wore socks with a normal thickness). I also struggle with plantar fasciitis and ankle pain - I just put some inserts in these boots and had no foot or ankle pain! These boots don't lie about being waterproof, either. I'm planning on these puppies getting me through a multi-day trip to Glacier National Park!
customer_reviews.author: Ella Bella

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: It really is a thing.... ankle aches, for DAYS if you do not have sturdy high top hiking boots like these. The uneven terrain during hiking really gets to u; it got to me when I went hiking with regular gym shoes. WHAT a difference, these hiking boots are it. And they had my size in wide feet!! High quality,stylish, easy to adjust tightness, and comfortable! My feet are the sweaty kind, even in cotton, but my feet did not really sweat in these. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: They are exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I try these boots on a retail store. Since the price tag at the store was significantly higher I decided to take a note on the size and model and check them online. Bought them a little bigger than my typical shoe size, I'm 8.5 and got a 9. Just to allow some breathing space when using thicker socks. I have taken them on two hiking trips and I notice a huge difference. When using sneakers after a few miles my feet hurt pretty bad. When using these shoes I can walk across distances like nobody else. Feet don't hurt at all and they are water resistant. Best purchase ever!!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed. Comfortable, water resistant, great tread. I have worn these on 3 hikes. They have kept me sure fitted and safe. Happy feet. I did order thick sock to wear. Since I followed others advice to get 1/2 to a size bigger. I wear a 7 and I got an 8. They fit great.l, with the thicker hiking socks. No blisters or sore feet.
customer_reviews.author: stephie

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking and even kayaking!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots!!! I not only have worn these hiking, but also to work on a rainy commute and even kayaking on a cold, fall day. I mean I didn’t fall in the water, but I got splashed plenty with the oar and waves. These boots keep my feet nice and dry and they’re not too heavy. They kept my feet drier than my boyfriend’s rain boots, and they’re half as heavy. They also protect my ankles from rolling, and don’t even hurt my toes when I go downhill while hiking. My old boots used to kill my toes on the descent.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable durability
customer_reviews.text: I discovered days before a big hiking trip that my hiking boots were shot. I ordered these and worried about breaking them in on the trail. We camped 5 days in the Chisos Basin and I wore them all day every day. They not only kept my feet warm in freezing temperatures but they were comfortable. We hiked miles on miles without a single twinge of discomfort. I ran, jumped, climbed, and not a single sign of wear, even walked through a creek. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle L. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Not for those w/ high arch / in-step
customer_reviews.text: The tongue of the boot is sewn all the way so there isn't enough give for my high arch / high in-step feet. Perhaps for someone with flatter feet these would be fine. I didn't think that the cushion and inserts were enough compared to other brands. There was nothing about these hiking boots that made my feet say, "please walk 10 mile right now." I would rather wear my 20 year old Salomons.
customer_reviews.author: Calli Adler

customer_reviews.title: Affordable & Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Took these on 2 weeks of hiking and camping across the US. I wouldn't trust them in a situation where they'd get absolutely drenched but they did a great job through short rainfalls and stayed dry and warm throughout the Cascades. The best thing is that they were comfortable IMMEDIATELY. I spent a few days wearing them around the house before taking them on the trip and I NEVER GOT A BLISTER! Even when I use regular socks instead of wool NOT. ONE. BLISTER. If you're planning on backpacking through the Arctic or something.. these are not what your looking for. If you're a casual hiker/camper these are PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia A

customer_reviews.title: Love them so far.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the boots once so far, but hope to use them many more times. I completed an easy 2.5 mile hike in them, and it did not feel like I was breaking them in. I wore wool socks and did not have any pain or discomfort in them. I also walked through shallow water and it slid right off, you could not tell i had just stepped in water. I accidentally stepped in deeper water toward the end of the hike and a little did go inside but I think that is to be expected. I love them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Hiking must have boots :)
customer_reviews.text: I love hiking but have not had great shoes for the adventures. I decided to purchase these (my first hiking boots) for my recent trip to Hocking Hills. I LOVE them. They fit perfectly and were comfortable for both days of hiking. It had rained prior to my trip so the trails were muddy. These boots didn’t fail me. I didn’t slip at all and I love that they are waterproof. If you’re looking for a great set of hiking boots I definitely recommend these. I would suggest higher socks to protect your skin from boot/skin rubbing. I’m very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Shoes I Have Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable. I bought mine per a recommendation from 2 of my friends & now there have been 3 other friends of ours that have a pair too. I usually order a half size up when it comes to outdoor wear, so my feet can have breathing room (I have wide feet & get blisters easily). I have yet to get any blisters with these shoes - they are lightweight & breathable. They look like klonkers, but they definitely don't feel that way. I have used these anywhere from mild hikes, wet hikes, & intense or lengthy hikes, & have yet to have any issues with comfort. I would highly recommend these excellent hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and no slipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! I’m extremely impressed with these boots. I have a wide foot so I usually take between a 9 and 10 depending on the shoe. I saw these came in wide so I went with the 9 wide and they fit like a glove. They are extremely comfortable right out the box. I’ve gone on two hikes with them so far. The last one being 6.3 miles in rough terrain which was also damp with wet leaves from the night before rain. There were high climbs with steep steps and mud. I did not slip one time! I think I found my go to boot!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Langenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Good support, comfortable, waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 1/2 size larger and wide width to accommodate custom orthotics because I have arthritis in both feet. These boots are so comfortable. I wear them to do barn chores and they're great. Good padding on the tongue and around the ankle. Very satisfied and definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Joan F.

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable I’ve ever been on a trail...
customer_reviews.text: These boots were super comfy, even right out of the box. I like that they’re lightweight too, and very flexible, not stiff like my other hiking boots in the past. I always go a half size larger when I buy hiking boots to allow room in the toe box for going downhill. I normally wear a 7 1/2 and I got an 8. They fit perfectly, required very little breaking in, and performed well on the trail. In fact, these are the most comfortable hiking boots I’ve ever worn in my life! I love the color and the red laces. They kept my feet dry when I had to cross a little creek. And they clean up easy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chaussee

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pair about 1 month ago for a trip to Montana and Wyoming (Glacier Park and Yellowstone). I am a beginner hiker and read this pair did the job - well, they more than delivered! They are sturdy, no breaking in necessary, sufficient space for thick hiking socks but not too big for slim socks either, very much waterproof unless completely submerged. Ankle support was moderate (mine are very weak so I wore an ankle guard anyway). Where you put your foot they stick which is perfect on slippery rocks. After 12 days of daily hiking, some as much as 20 mles a day - these boots have zero damage or wear. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Boots are as described, even the color and fit true to size. I can wear a 71/2 wide or an 8B in most boots and these fit perfect with a medium hiking sock. I can only give 4 stars for now because I’m not hiking in them! I have great hikers, these are for walking about 😁. I’ll update this review after I’ve walked in them for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: JP Smith

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots to prepare for my Alaskan/Canadian adventure. I sized up 1/2 a size as some had suggested and they were a just a tad big. I think they would have fit as expected and are true to size. However, the size was not a big deal. I wore thick socks and still had comfortable and breathable room, so my personal suggestion would be to order your true size for a tight secure fit. These boots endured different types of terrain and climates. Glaciers, rain forest and rain. And when I wasn’t hiking and just exploring the town, they were comfortable enough to enjoy a nice stroll through town. They held up great! I would definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Wink

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, not bulky.
customer_reviews.text: These hiking boots are comfortable, supportive and they have a lower profile than my old hiking boots, which felt heavy and looked boxy. No break in period required as they are comfortable right out of the box. I ordered my regular size for closed toe shoes, 8.5 and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Marvell-Sellentin

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe so much that I have 5 different pairs. I like the support in the ankle, as someone with arthritis at the big toe, and a fused foot, it's like walking on air. I love the support, the fit, and it is a great shoe to wear not only hiking, but at work in a lab. It is protective. One does have to be cautious about walking on pea gravel, then going inside and walking on a nice floor, as the gravel does tend to stick in the grooves. I bought my first pair for a National park vacation, which then could not happen, but I regret nothing in getting these shoes. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been on a few hikes with these boots to break them in and they’re pretty great. They’re very light-weight, which is a huge plus for me. They don’t overheat my feet (and I have to endure the Texas summer of 100+F!!). They survived through a rain storm with the boots being nearly dry (slightly damp... duh!) and my feet dry. They handled slipped rock very well. I’ll be hiking through ice later in the winter, and I would imagine they would be fine. Overall, very happy with the boots!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Zech

customer_reviews.title: Love❤️❤️ Suggest you size up
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered an 8, I’m military and LIVE in boots. They ‘just’ fit and left boot felt tighter...then I put a sock on and knew it was going to be a no-go. So snug I knew in colder climate would make my feet cold and have memorable break in period. No thanks. Boxed them, sent them back for free, got refunded same day and ordered 1/2 size bigger. Perfect....and they feel like the normal 8’s I would wear!!! Love the speed lacing at top ...you can untie and slip them off w/o loosening. Slip back on cross laces twice, tie & go. I hate loosen and tightening boots to get them on and off. Big plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy & water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and definitely water resistant! I’ve worn these on a few hikes that involved walking through creeks and along shoreline and had water up to my ankle but these stayed dry and the color is still perfect. No blisters, which I normally get from new shoes. These are like walking on clouds. They are sturdy for your ankles on rocks and have good grip - not immune to slippery rocks but much better than sneakers. So glad I got them and can’t wait for more family hikes.
customer_reviews.author: KrisSquared

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, comfortable, true to size
customer_reviews.text: Colombia hiking boots is just what I needed for hiking one of the seven wonders of the world. I bought them last minute, not getting my hopes up but to my surprise they where every thing I needed and more! These boots, kept my feet dry in the pouring rain, wonderful grips to climb boulders, ankle sport for that rough terrain, and to me very stylish. I could not stop talking about how awesome these boots are on the entire trip.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: in love with these boots!
customer_reviews.text: i’ve hiked around 50 miles so far in these. i need a thinner sock in them, but otherwise they fit great and needed no breaking in. very sturdy, zero slippage on wet rocks. laces stay tight and don’t slip. kept my feet dry during a 7 mile rainy hike today! i don’t find them too warm - they certainly are not breezy like a lighter shoe would be but they’re not too heavy or warm at all. i have not worn them in high temps yet but with the right sock i believe they’ll be just fine in warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots are solid. Very comfortable for day to day and trail use. Traction is decent. As you walk around the lip of the boot comes forward a lot. Looks a bit awkward more like a shoe less streamline boot if that makes sense, even with lacing the highest lace. It typically moves to the base of the foot and the lip comes forward. So I suppose for cold weather this would/will be problematic as snow and moisture can get in at the base of the leg. :/
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Soles not very long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: Have had these a little over six months. I walk 75 miles a month on trail and pavement, these soles cannot keep up. The soles are worn through in large spots and showing the grey part just below the upper (on the blue with orange laces version, see photo). They are decently waterproof and I may buy another pair because they are the most comfortable I've found out of Keen, Merrell, and Columbia. I love the colors, the uppers are very durable, as are the laces.
customer_reviews.author: Human783

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size up
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical about ordering these a half size up since most of the reviews say it's true to size. However, your feet will thank you. I'm a true 6.5, but with the extra room, I wore wool socks on a short hike (4 miles) on a hot day and I cannot say enough great things about this boot. Lightweight and has great look. Zero break-in time! You can't go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.author: Muay Thai Mama

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but too narrow
customer_reviews.text: My most comfortable fit is 8.5W, though I can often get away with a standard 8.5. In stiff shoes that don't come in wide sizes, I usually size up to a 9, so I went with the 9 here (since the wides were out of stock), and couldn't even leave it on my foot for ten minutes without the squeeze becoming painful. Plenty of room around my toes, but not the wide part of my foot at all. These seem well made and sturdy, but definitely don't try to squeeze into a standard size if you tend to wear wide sizes (even if you size up!)
customer_reviews.author: RJT

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased them a couple of times until I got it right. I wear a size 9 in most shoes but ended up with a 9-1/2 wide. I normally do not wear a wide shoe but with boots I figured I would wear thicker socks. They fit perfectly. I wore them last night and they were so comfortable. I would highly recommend these boots plus they are really cute.
customer_reviews.author: Terri L. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hiking Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these boots! They fit as expected and were very comfortable from the very beginning - there was no serious break-in time necessary. I think they're stylish and easily complement any hiking attire. My feet never felt like they were overheating and I was able to cross any terrain because they are waterproof. I've worn them in Acadia NP, the Grand Canyon, Zion NP, and more. They've held up like nearly new for over a year now and I can't wait to wear them on my next hiking adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Bargain - Great for Flat Feet & Weak Ankles
customer_reviews.text: I went on a 5-mile hike, carrying my 30lb daughter in a hiking baby carrier on my back, and these shoes were comfortable the entire time and supported my ankles well. I have problems finding comfortable shoes with my flat feet, and these were of no issue. I also have problems with not enough ankle support and ankle boots rubbing the back of my ankles wrong, and neither of those issues came up with these shoes. With all of the positives I experienced with these boots, I thought I would have had to pay more. Truly a bargain for the price! 3 stars for water resistance because it did not apply to my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Kaninta Hill

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but some blisters
customer_reviews.text: These boots are super cute. I wanted to give them a shot before reviewing. I put them to the test on a 5 mile hike today. This was without breaking them in. They didn't do too bad. I did end up with some blisters on my toes. On my big toe and pink toes and the bottom of another toe. Next time I'll try with some different socks. My feet actually don't hurt too bad but I hope that they do get more broken in so I can manage longer hikes. they did really well on rocky terrain and even some scrambling, really good grip!
customer_reviews.author: colleen

customer_reviews.title: Looks cute BUT comfort level is not there
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look of this boot, and the brand I thought was great also. I have had this boot for awhile, but I only wear it when I go for a rough terrain hike with sharp rocks or major inclines. My feet are fine on the way up, but on the way down, it's either runs too small but this shoe doesn't have a size above 11. I am at least a 12.5 in women's due to the pain in my toes. I don't wear it as often as I would like, but I have a few trail shoes if I cannot handle wearing this boot for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Tía

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, waterproof and they look fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I get compliments EVERY time I wear them. I bought them for a 2 week safari trip to Kenya Africa and they were perfect. They are super comfy but best if all so cute. And because they are waterproof after a day in the red mud rain at the elephant orphanage they cleaned up so nice with a few wet wipes in the hotel while others' shoes seemed ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya G

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: It’s true. They wear like they’re already broken in fresh off the box. The color was more brown in person but when light hits them they are closer to the image as pictured by Amazon (elk). They are indeed closer to the color of elks. Lol. They’re stylish while comfy and don’t make my feet look big. Big plus. Take note. My feet are 10.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty Smith

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction but beautiful boot
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these boots because the right toe box area was shaped differently than the left Toe box area. While the boot was comfy they looked very odd on my feet with the two different shapes – a clear default on the right boot.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Functional Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical buying hiking boots online, without being able to try them on. No regrets here; these boots fit great, I ordered an 8.5, which is my running shoe size. We took these boots on 3 long hikes already. They were comfortable the entire. I accidentally tested the waterproofing, which is also great. I had great traction, even with the accidentally steps into the creek. The boots are a bit pricey, but if you want a high quality, comfortable hiking boot, they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Muente

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, great bargain.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. These are my first pair of hiking boots, and I have been very satisfied with my purchase. The photo was the first time I used them, trekking about 4 miles through Providence Canyon State Park, but since then, they have traversed all over, and are holding up tremendously well. They are comfortable, waterproof, have great gripping soles, and provide plenty of stability for your ankles. I would definitely purchase again, though it seems I won’t be in the market for another pair for quite a while considering how well these are holding up! I did size up half a size for hiking socks and would recommend anyone else doing the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstie

customer_reviews.title: But these! Adventure awaits!
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and I ordered my true size the 8 wide, and they are perfect. I can’t stress how much I love these boots. Ive worn them hiking a few times already and they allowing me to feel comfortable even walking up and down Northern California muddy hills and trails after the rain. Quality comfort fit and style are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: LizzyBelle

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready fora trip to Iceland and looking for good boots that will keep my feet warm and good for hiking. I tried on several different brands of boots and the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus fit the best and provides the best ankle support. The big test will be Iceland. From the other reviews I've read, I'm sure they will do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena Navia

customer_reviews.title: great for hiking through Arizona
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots to hike through Arizona and they were awesome! A little larger than expected, but even with them being a little loose, they were not too loose. I did some intense hiking and they held up well. My one complaint is the amount of rocks that got in them due to the lack of tight ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Tina McEntire

customer_reviews.title: No real tongue!
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes but found a trend in this and similar shoes that I do not like. I have a fused ankle which makes my too stiff to maneuver into a shoe as others might do. I found it almost impossible to fit my foot into this shoe. For some reason manufactures have done away with the traditional tongue. A tongue would open the shoe so I could more easily put it on. use a shoe horn, which helps but it is still difficult. I have even considered, but not done, cutting the shoe to creat a better, more traditional tongue.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Henry

customer_reviews.title: Size up, but very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a very nice quality for the price. I have narrow feet, so despite the many reviews saying to size up, I decided to go with my usual size 7. My big toe was hitting the front even with thin socks on, so I should have sized up. I ended up getting the 7.5, and my toe doesn’t hit the front anymore. If you plan on wearing these with thick socks, I’d recommend going up a whole size. Otherwise, they’re very comfortable (from the short period I spent walking around my house in them).
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear 8.5. I tried 8 first, it was okay, but I ended up choosing 8.5 wide, and I did not regret it. It was not tight, I could wear a pair of thick socks and it was still comfortable. As other reviewers mentioned, there's no need to break it in, I used it first them when I climbed Pacaya and it was perfect. I had never had a pair of hiking boots before, so I do not have any comparation, but I love this pair!
customer_reviews.author: Zizike

customer_reviews.title: SIZE UP A HALF SIZE!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I decided to size up (I usually wear a 6 and I ordered a 6.5) and it's PERFECT. I usually never ever size up, but since I don't know anything about hiking boots, I relied heavily on the reviews. I wore these with wool socks for a 10 mile hike. The boots were very comfortable and didn't need to be broken in. I'm pretty flat footed so if you require arch support you might need to put in your own inserts. They're really cute and I think I'll wear them as winter boots during the cold months!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Protective, comfortable and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is perfect for me! I love how thick the bottom sole is. They are not heavy on the foot as you walk either, which is one thing I was originally worried about. They kept my feet completely dry as I walked through flooded trails this weekend. My feet were comfortable through the whole 6 mile hike. I often get arch pain from new shoes and I did not feel any uncomfortable pain what so ever from these boots. Plus they’re cute! I really like the blue suede and coral laces. Super happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are great! Good ankle support
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a field school in the PNW. They are great! Good ankle support, hold up to walking through brambles, stinging nettle, devil's club and fallen trees/twigs, as well as holding up beautifully when walking through mucky ground or sandy beaches. Have been wearing them nearly every day, all day, for over a month and they still look brand new. They're comfortable and fit great with a pair or two of thick socks. I took other's advice in the reviews and sized up. I usually wear between an 8 1/2 and a 9. The 9 1/2 fits great with hiking socks (Dickies Dritech Wicking Crew and Smartwool Hiking Medium). These boots are fantastic, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Francesca FioreTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfy
customer_reviews.text: True to size, I normally wear either a 7.5 to an 8 depending on the shoe. I went with an 8 because it fit good, enough space to wear a thicker sock. I have a narrow foot so I did have enough room on either side. If your foot runs on the wide side they might fit a little snug. Used them to go on a hike several times and they did not disappoint. Very sturdy and comfy. Plus they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These boots were amazing on our trip to CO. 1 for myself and one for my son. Sizes were exact. Even in June, there is snow at peaks, but warm at the base. Wore with 2 socks on snow hikes and 1 in town. They felt great with no breaking in. Water doesn't even beed up on these, it just can't penetrate. It is hard to believe I paid that price...you would think they are way more expensive. Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: Simon James

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots last minute for a 2-day hiking trip up Half Dome in Yosemite, and they did not disappoint. True to other reviews, I did not have a break-in period, they never gave me any problems with blisters or otherwise from day 1. I was able to hike through the water on the Mist Trail and my feet were kept completely dry. They had great grip for when I needed it most climbing up the cables of Half Dome. I also took them on the Via Ferrata in Telluride, and while these are not approach shoes (I'm not a regular rock climber), they did the job well enough. I'm very happy with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots around!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have purchased a pair of hiking boots without trying them on. After reading the reviews and see and they had exactly the size I needed a 10 1/2, the color I liked was available and I ordered it. Super happy with the product! They fit like a dream. This is the first time I have purchased a pair of hiking boots without trying them on. After reading the reviews and see and they had exactly the size I needed a 10 1/2, the color I liked was available and I ordered it. Super happy with the product! They fit like a dream
customer_reviews.author: Kim Funk

customer_reviews.title: Thus far it's just what I asked for
customer_reviews.text: As a flat footed individual it's hard for me to find a good pair of hiking boots that don't kill my feet so I'm glad they offered wide options. As soon as I put them on they felt comfortable. They give me good ankle support and don't have an insane arch making it extremely uncomfortable or unbearable which is how most boots are for me. Just got them today and am breaking them in now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!! WORTH IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these hiking shoes! It is one of the best purchases I have ever made, NO exaggeration. I waited too long to buy hiking boots because I used to wear regular nike or adidas sneakers, and it was never comfortable enough for hiking. The best thing about these shoes is it keeps you from SLIPPING when you're hiking UP and DOWN trails. I absolutely love how I don't slip on steep rocky dirt trails. It is also extremely sturdy and comfortable. I ordered a size 5 W, and it fits perfectly. I usually order size 5's unless I want more room with a size 6; my feet are wider so 5 W was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Cola

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: I did order two sizes to ensure I got the right fit. I'm glad I did! These are SO comfy and sturdy. I love the colors, they make me so happy. They are so dangerous they are cute because I kept looking at my feet while hiking and almost died a few times. So please, refrain from staring at your feet no matter how cute your boots are. The are a keeper for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin & Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is fantastic. I bought it specifically for hiking in Yosemite and it did it’s job perfectly. The only reason I’m taking away a star is because all the hiking caused my feet to swell and the toes became squished and both my pinky toes got huge blisters. The toe area could be a little wider but when I wore it out and about running errands to break them in, I had zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: H.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great boot but sadly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to keep these boots. The color is great the comfort is great the construction is excellent BUT the toe box needs a-lot of work. When your foot bends to walk the toe area where the laces end jams into your toes. How utterly disappointing 😑 sending them back
customer_reviews.author: Kristy R.

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: Best investment. Honestly for the cost being on the cheaper end of what I was anticipating for my outdoor shoes I was over the moon with what I get. Wore them on a ski trip in Breckenridge and they did great in the snow - good grip, no fear of slipping. I also wore them in The Narrows hike at Zion National Park and was please with how they helped up in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Zola Polynice

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and lightweight. Fits just as expected. I am a true medium width and often find hiking style boots too wide, but these were just right. Only downside is the double hooks instead of holes for the laces, but I guess that's how they're all made. I find that awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Willa I. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for novice hikers
customer_reviews.text: These boots were a great purchase prior to a recent camping trip. I took the advice of other reviewers and went up a half size when ordered (usually am a 9.5, but ordered a 10.) They fit like a glove—not too tight, but also room for a thick, hiking sock. I wore them all weekend without breaking them in ahead of time, but no blisters or discomfort. Highly, HIGHLY recommend these boots! My fiancé is ordering a pair for himself now!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie H

customer_reviews.title: She wanted hiking boots....
customer_reviews.text: Listen.. Sometimes you just take the hint and run with it. Don't try to be something you aren't.. She told me this is what she wanted, and I bought it. Simple. No stress. No unreasonable expectations. Sometime the smart thing to do is to be up front and honest. I say... "What do you want for your birthday babe?" She says.. "These hiking boots" I say... "I got this, pass me the remote, enough Lifetime channel"
customer_reviews.author: The Boog

customer_reviews.title: Colorado hiker approved!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a die hard Columbia fan and these don't disappoint! Live in Colorado and hike weekly over off-the-beaten-path terrain. Boots get lots and lots of legitimate wear and tear, and these are up to the task. They are a little warm but most good waterproof boots are...summer just means hot feat or settling for running shoes. Comfortable right out of the box, no "break in" period. As with ALL Columbia hiking boots I've had they run about quarter/half size large so order your usual size and have PLENTY of room for thick hiking socks.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyLou111

product_meta.title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Finally, a stylish waterproof hiking boot with the comfort and traction you need for tough trails, easy walks—and every adventure in between. The Newton Ridge™ Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot is made from high quality materials, quality assembly, and strong stitching. It’s a rugged trail-ready boot designed for long lasting hiking wear. Lace up and go. These hiking boots feature waterproof seam-sealed construction combined with a full grain leather and suede upper, mesh tongue, along with a scratch rubber heel, and outdoor lace hardware. This is the secure and stable boot you want on long treks over uneven and rugged terrain. Columbia offers these women's hiking boots available in several color versions, with true-to-fit sizing. Imported. Leather upper. Laced closure. Hand Wash.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: The Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot features a seam-sealed construction, combined with our TECHLITE lightweight midsole, for long-lasting comfort with superior cushioning and high energy return.

DURABLE HIKING BOOT: This women's boot is inspired by classic mountaineering style. A durable mid cut waterproof hiker that provides great traction and comfort. This classic Columbia hiking boot, will deliver reliable and comfortable service.
ALL TERRAIN TRACTION: Our signature Omni-GRIP non-marking traction rubber outsole provides high grip across a wide variety of terrain, and versatile three season use.
REINFORCED TOE AND HEEL CONSTRUCTION: Designed for extended years of use, we’ve reinforced the toe and heel barriers, and extended the outsole toe overwrap to guard these key wear points.
HANDY FEATURES: Treacherous days out on the trail are comfortable and worry-free with this hiking boot's waterproof combination of supportive leather and suede construction.
